title: Re-live: AFL grand final parade
text:
AFL: Speaking at the AFL Grand Final parade Hawthorns Jack Gunston hilariously admits his mum is feeling a little bit hungover from the night before Fox Sports 02 Oct 2015 Sport/AFL/News Hawthorn captain Luke Hodge waves to fans during the Grand Final Parade. Picture: Hamish Blair Source: News Corp Australia 
AFL players are notorious for unnecessarily wearing sunglasses during the grand final parade. 
However it was a player’s parent who had to don the glasses on Friday, following an enjoyable past 24 hours. 
As 44 other Hawthorn and West Coast players lapped up the sunshine and atmosphere, the mother of Jack Gunston was nursing a sore head, according to the returning Hawks forward. 
Gunston immediately spotted his dad, Ray, at the Old Treasury Building. 
“Mum would’ve dragged him here,” Gunston told Fox Footy. 
SCROLL DOWN TO RE-LIVE OUR AFL GRAND FINAL PARADE COVERAGE IN OUR BLOG ... 
But then Gunston threw his mum under the bus, admitting to Ben Dixon that she mightn’t have been in the best shape for the big day. 
“Mum was a bit hung-over from yesterday — I think she’d had a few drinks,” Gunston said. 
“But it was good to see them there. I gave them a nice wave.” 
Gunston, his teammates and opponents all took part in the parade, which took a new route down Wellington Pde. 
It started at the top of Collins St then crawled down Wellington Pde before turning right down Clarendon St and into the new AFL live site at Yarra Park.
